str.definition: Strength represents the character's raw physical power: how much damage he does in HTH Combat; how much he can lift, carry, and throw, and so forth.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

dex.definition: Dexterity represents a character's agility and reaction time.

con.definition: Constitution represents a character's health and hardiness.

int.definition: Intelligence represents a character's ability to take in and process information quickly.

ego.definition: Ego represents a character's mental strength and strength of will.

pre.definition: Presence represents the character's forcefulness, charisma, bravery, and leadership qualities -- in short, his impressiveness.

spd.definition: Speed represents how many Phases a character has in a Turn, and when they occur.

pd.definition: Physical Defense represents a character's ability to withstand damage from physical attacks such as punches.

ed.definition: Energy Defense represents a character's ability to withstand damage from energy attacks such as electricity or fire.

rec.definition: Recovery represents how fast a character recovers from being exhausted or knocked out; it also allows the character to heal more quickly.

end.definition: Endurance represents the energy a character expends to act, exert himself, and use his powers -- the more END he has, the longer he can keep doing things.

body.definition: Body represents how much damage a character can take before dying.

stun.definition: Stun represents how much damage a character can take before being Knocked Out.

running.definition: Running is a character's ground movement rate. It is listed on the Characteristics tab in HD because of its interaction with some characteristics and its interaction with the Normal Characteristics Maxima Disadvantage.

swimming.definition: Swimming is a character's movement rate in water or other liquids. It is listed on the Characteristics tab in HD because of its interaction with some characteristics and its interaction with the Normal Characteristics Maxima Disadvantage.

leaping.definition: Leaping is a character's ability to leap long distances. It is listed on the Characteristics tab in HD because of its interaction with some Characteristics and its interaction with Normal Characteristic Maxima.

adder.definition: This Adder represents a character whose Leaping is always accurate. The 	character need not make an Attack Roll to land in his target hex.

modifier.definition: Leaping with this Limitation does not improve a character's vertical 	leap, only his forward leap.

skill.definition: This Agility skill allows a character to perform flips, jumps, and rolls like a circus acrobat. Acrobatics enables the character to jump from one moving vehicle to another safely, swing from flagpoles, bounce off awnings, and execute other tricky moves. A character with Acrobatics could jump and flip over an obstacle, then land on his feet, ready to fight.

This Interaction skill enables the character to alter his physical mannerisms and speech patterns to seem to be another person, to fool someone, or to fake moods and emotions. Characters can use it to hide their true identity or to impersonate another individual.

This Intellect Skill allows a character to analyze another character's abilities or skills to determine the other character's level of power or degree of competence. The character must specify what he can analyze using this Skill when he buys it.
This Agility Skill allows a character to roll out from a fall and stand up without taking a Half Phase. A successful roll also means the character takes only half damage from the fall.
A character with this Interaction Skill knows when to bribe someone, how to approach him, and how much to offer.

Characters with this Intellect Skill can plant and operate listening, visual, or other sensing devices ("bugs") properly, and "sweep" (search physically or with detectors) for bugs. A successful roll lets a character find an existing bug or correctly place microphones or cameras and get good sound or video reception from them.

A character with this Interaction Skill can deal with bureaucrats, cut through red tape, and extract information from bureaucracies. He also knows the right people to talk to (for just about anything) and how to reach them.

This Interaction Skill is the ability to gain others' trust by offering companionship orfavors. Depending on the circumstances, its uses can range from simply making friends, togetting on someone's good side, to outright sexual seduction. Charm is normally only for use onNPCs; a player should have more control over his character's actions. The GM may rule thatCharm can be used on a PC when it fits his Complications or personality.
This Agility Skill allows a character to climb unusually difficult walls, trees, and buildings, as long as handholds exist.

Characters with this Agility Skill can drive and control a ground or water vehicle in difficult situations. It applies to all vehicles which operate in two dimensions, from carts and chariots to automobiles, to surface boats and ships. Characters who take this Skill will receive a free 1-point Transport Familiarity in the appropriate category.

Characters with this Agility Skill can pilot and control vehicles which operate in three dimensions (everything from airplanes, to submarines, to space-ships) in difficult situations (primarily combat). Characters who take this Skill will receive a free 1-point Transport Familiarity in the appropriate category.

modifier.definition: Concealment	bought with this modifier can only be used to conceal the character who buys 	it. It cannot be used conceal others.

skill.definition: This Intellect Skill represents a character's ability to hide things and to find things which others have hidden -- important papers, weapons, jewels, artifacts, drugs, and so forth.
This Agility Skill gives a character the ability to manipulate his body so as to get out of ropes and other bonds.
This Interaction Skill allows a character to extract information from people with careful conversation and/or to be an entertaining conversationalist.
A character with this Intellect Skill knows how to look for clues, dust for fingerprints, analyze evidence, examine criminal records and files, do ballistics tests, and so on.
This Intellect Skill allows a character to solve ciphers and codes, encrypt or encode messages, and hide messages in ordinary text.
Deduction, an Intellect Skill, represents the ability to take several facts and leap to an inobvious conclusion -- the classic detective's skill.

A character with this Intellect Skill can use explosives properly, and knows about different types of explosives, how to handle and set off explosives, where to plant explosives for maximum effect, how to estimate the amount necessary to destroy structures, and which types of explosives are best for which jobs. He may also defuse explosive devices, find a bomb's fusing mechanism, and discover any booby traps in an explosive device.

This Intellect Skill allows a character to change his appearance with makeup, costumes, body language, and facial expressions. He can, with a successful roll, alter his appearance to make himself unrecognizable, or disguise himself to look like a specific person. A character with this Skill can also disguise other characters.

This Agility Skill represents the ability to ready and use a weapon quickly. A character with Fast Draw can draw a weapon as a Zero-Phase Action instead of the usual Half-Phase Action. Characters must buy Fast Draw separately for each type of weapon they wish to use the Skill with.

Characters with this Intellect Skill can make inferences from a corpse about the cause of death, how long the individual has been dead, if the corpse was moved after death, and so forth. The character can also perform autopsies. He may spot obvious data about the corpse with just a cursory glance; a full autopsy takes several hours.

Characters with this Interaction Skill know about upper-class culture and how to interact with it: what clothes to wear, what are considered "sophisticated" drinks, which fork to use for shrimp, how to mingle with royalty, and who's who among VIPs, who likes who, the gossip and "court politics" applicable to the situation, and so forth.

A character with this Interaction Skill can extract information from people, either forcibly or through psychological manipulation. He knows how to avoid leaving marks, can judge how close a victim is to death or breaking, and is an expert at manipulating subjects into revealing the desired information.

This Intellect Skill allows a character to design and construct new devices. It represents that spark of genius, creativity, or perhaps madness which leads to new discoveries. Inventor does not grant a character any scientific or technical knowledge; to use it, he needs related Skills.
This Intellect Skill allows a character to read someone's lips to tell what he's saying. The character must know the language being spoken to lipread it successfully.
This Agility Skill allows a character to open key, combination, electronic, and magnetic locks using special tools instead of keys.
A character with this Intellect Skill can repair, replace, and build mechanical devices. It also allows a character to modify mechanical devices.
A character with this Intellect Skill can imitate someone else's voice, or certain other sounds, perfectly.
This Interaction Skill represents the ability to speak to an audience and to deliver a convincing presentation.
Characters with this Intellect Skill can perform first aid, stop bleeding, repair damage, and generally keep someone alive.
Characters with this Interaction Skill can convince, persuade, or influence individuals, or tell believable lies.
This Skill represents a character's ability to use one of his powers or abilities in creative or unusual ways.
Characters with this Agility Skill can ride a living creature under difficult circumstances. Characters who purchase this Skill get a free Transport Familiarity in the appropriate category.
These Background Skills give a character a solid grasp of and working knowledge of a particular field of science.
A character with this Intellect Skill can locate, recognize, evade, and build various types of alarms and traps.
This Intellect Skill is the ability to follow or watch someone subtly.
This Agility Skill represents the ability to palm items, fool the eye, perform certain magic tricks, and so forth.
Characters with this Agility Skill can hide in shadows, move silently, and/or avoid detection in combat situations.

This Interaction Skill gives a character knowledge of the seamy side of civilization: he knows how to find the black market, talk to thugs and criminals, gain information, deal with organized (and not so organized) crime figures, and so on. He also knows who the main powers are on the street and in the underworld, and the location of their spheres of influence.
Characters with this Intellect Skill know how to fight effectively and efficiently.
This Agility Skill reflects a character's ability to fight well with others in combat.
Characters with this Intellect Skill can follow a trail by observing tracks, marks, broken twigs, and so forth, and also know how to hide tracks.
This Interaction Skill gives a character the ability to strike a good bargain with a merchant or a customer.
A character with this Intellect Skill can make his voice sound as if it's coming from somewhere other than himself. Ventriloquism also allows him to speak without apparently moving his lips.

animalHandler.definition: This Interaction Skill lets a character train animals to do his bidding. The handler can manage all animals which he knows about. The chance to train an animal depends on the handler's Skill Roll. Moreover, the temperament of the animal makes a difference -- it's much easier to train a beagle than a camel or griffon. Training usually takes weeks, but a skillful Animal Handler can do it much more quickly.

autofireSkills.definition: These four Combat Skills enable characters to use Autofire attacks more efficiently. Characters can "stack" them together to, for example, execute Accurate, Concentrated, Skipover Sprayfire.

option.display: with a small group of attacks
with a large group of attacks

combatLevels.definition: Once a character knows how to use an attack, he can improve his skill with it by buying Combat Skill Levels. Combat Skill Levels (CSLs) have several potential uses, though a character can only use a CSL for one thing at a time. A character can change the assignment of his CSLs as a Zero-Phase Action (after he attacks, his CSLs stay as they are until his next Phase begins or he Aborts to a defensive Action).

option.display: with a group of Mental Powers

mentalCombatLevels.definition: Ordinary Combat Skill Levels do not apply to Mental Powers or attacks that use OMCV(unless the GM rules otherwise). Instead, characters have to buy Mental Combat Skill Levels(MCSLs).

computerProgramming.definition: A character with this Intellect Skill can program and operate computers. This includes knowledge of, and the ability to use, hardware, software, operating systems, and the like. All characters that take this ability will be in direct competition with the writer of Hero Designer. Choosing any of the categories or subtypes will use the expanded rules defined in Star Hero. Not selecting any categories or subtypes will use the rules as stated in Hero System Sixth Edition Rule Book.

cramming.definition: This Intellect Skill allows a character to acquire a basic understanding of a non-combat Skill quickly. The character needs several hours to study the Skill, and must have access to learning resources, like a teacher or a library. After studying the subject, the character acquires a Familiarity (an 8- roll) with the Skill, or basic conversation (1 point) in a language, or any 1-point Skill (such as a TF or a WF) which he can use for the duration of the adventure. Cramming may be purchased multiple times, allowing a character to Cram for more than one Skill per adventure.

defenseManeuver.definition: A character with this Combat Skill is an expert at moving while in combat. He never allows an attacker a clear shot at his back. This Skill requires a Half-Phase Action to use. When performed, Defense Maneuver offers several benefits, depending on how many points the character has spent on it.

electronics.definition: This Intellect Skill allows a character to identify, understand, build, repair and rewire electronic devices. Choosing any of the defined Systems or System Groups will use the expanded rules from Star Hero. Not selecting any Systems or System Groups will use the default rules as stated in Hero System Sixth Edition Rule Book.

adder.definition: Official documents, signatures, seals, magnetic codes, and so 		forth
Passports, drivers' licenses, Social Security cards, 		badges

forgery.definition: This Intellect Skill represents the ability to duplicate documents, objects, and money.

gambling.definition: This Intellect Skill represents a character's ability to win gambling games which require some skill, such as blackjack, poker, and more exotic games. Characters can also use Gambling to cheat, unless cheating requires Sleight of Hand.

knowledgeSkill.definition: This very general and flexible Background Skill includes knowledge of certain groups, places, people and things -- any subject the character wishes to have knowledge of. The character must define the subject when he purchases the Skill.

adder.definition: If not standard for society

languages.definition: This Background Skill represents a level of fluency in, and knowledge of, a language.

navigation.definition: A character with this Intellect Skill can determine his location and plot an efficient course between two points.

option.display: to offset a specific negative OCV modifier with any single attack
to offset a specific negative OCV modifier with any three maneuvers or tight group
to offset a specific negative OCV modifier with all attacks
to offset a specific negative DCV modifier imposed by any single specific condition
to offset a specific negative DCV modifier imposed by a group of conditions

penaltySkillLevels.definition: Penalty Skill Levels (PSLs) are a type of Skill Level which only reduces a specific type of negative modifier for making particular types of attacks.

professionalSkill.definition: These Background Skills give a character the ability to perform certain professions, crafts, tasks, and the like.

rapidAttackHth.definition: A character with this Combat Skill has a heightened ability to move in combat. Rapid Attack allows a character to make an attack with the Rapid Fire Combat Maneuver, Sweep Combat Maneuver, or Autofire Skills as a Half Phase Action.

option.display: with single Skill or Characteristic Roll
with all Intellect Skills, all Interaction Skills, or a similar broad group

skillLevels.definition: Skill Levels give bonuses to related Skills.

survival.definition: Characters with this Intellect Skill can live off of the land, find food and water, hunt game, locate or build crude shelters, identify dangerous plants and animals, and so on.

systemsOperation.definition: Characters with this Intellect Skill understand how to operate sensing and communication devices properly. Choosing any of the defined Systems or System Groups will use the expanded rules from Star Hero. Not selecting any Systems or System Groups will use the default rules as stated in Hero System Sixth Edition Rule Book.

transportFamiliarity.definition: This Background Skill allows characters to drive or pilot specific types of vehicles, or ride a living mount, under routine conditions.

twoWeaponFightingHth.definition: A character with this Combat Skill has been trained to fight with two weapons, one in each hand.

weaponFamiliarity.definition: Weapon Familiarity represents the knowledge of how to use specific weapons.

weaponsmith.definition: Characters with this Intellect Skill can make, maintain, and repair various types of weapons. They can also identify the origin, uses, and effects of any weapon they are familiar with or have time to analyze.

extradc.definition: HTH Damage Classes allow a character to increase the damage that he does with all of his HTH Martial Maneuvers.

rangeddc.definition: Ranged Damage Classes allow a character to increase the damage that he does with all of his Ranged Martial Maneuvers.

weaponElement.definition: Weapon Elements allow a character to use his Martial Maneuvers with (or without) weapons.

maneuver.effect: Grab Weapon, [STRDC] to take weapon away; Target Falls
Grab Two Limbs, [STRDC] for holding on; FMove
maneuver.weaponeffect: Grab Two Limbs, [STRDC] for holding on; FMove

maneuver.effect: [NORMALDC] +v/10 Strike; You Fall, Target Falls; FMove
[NORMALDC] Strike; Target Falls; Must Follow Grab
maneuver.weaponeffect: Weapon [WEAPONDC] Strike; Target Falls; Must Follow Grab

maneuver.effect: Grab Two Limbs, [STRDC] for holding on
maneuver.weaponeffect: Grab Two Limbs, [STRDC] for holding on
Weapon [WEAPONDC] Strike; You Fall, Target Falls

maneuver.effect: Grab Weapon, [STRDC] to take weapon away
maneuver.weaponeffect: Grab Weapon, [STRDC] to take weapon away

resourcePool.definition: Resource Point rules are intended to create a distinct poolof "points" that characters can use to "buy" weapons, equipment, Vehicles, Bases, Contacts, and other moreor less "fungible" resources that can easily change (i.e., be lost, used up, or used temporarily) during the courceof an adventure or campaign.

access.definition: A character with this Perk has access to heavily secured areas or buildings as a result of secret entrances or passages they know of or built, security passes they have stolen or forged, and so forth

perk.definition: A character with Anonymity has no official or police record, or if it does exist it doesn't contain any truly useful information
A character with this Perk has access to a heavily restricted database, such as those of governments or corporations.

A character with this Perk, also known as Alternate Identity, has a long established, nigh-unquestionable, false identity or disguise which he can use. The cover is so well-established that no one suspects it is a cover.

adder.definition: The character has two 	or more identities, and the Contact is only accessible to one.

adder.display: Contact has access to major institutions
Contact has significant Contacts of his own
Contact is slavishly loyal to character

modifier.definition: The Contact gives broader access to an entire organization, its 	resources, and its knowledge, instead of an individual

contact.definition: A character with this Perk knows someone who can occasionally help him out. Contacts usually hold a job or position which can be helpful to the character.

favor.definition: This Perk means someone, or some organization, owes the character a favor. The favor functions as Contact with a 14- roll. However, once the character uses the Favor, it's gone.

follower.definition: This Perk means the character has a Follower of some kind - an individual who is loyal to the character and willing to do what he asks.

adder.display: Right to Marry:  Can perform the marriage ceremony
Low Justice:  Character has the right to mete out justice.

option.display: Head of State of a single nation
Head of State of a very minor nation
Head of State of a planet
Head of State of a small interstellar society
Head of State of a minor nation
Head of State of a medium interstellar society
Head of State of average nation
Head of State of a large interstellar society

adder.definition: This Fringe Benefit should be taken by robots and androids who are not 	considered property
This Perk represents the benefits which accrue to a character from 	belonging to a large and/or powerful organization. The character can call on 	the group's resources when he needs them.
This Perk represents the character's access to classified or secret 	data. Typically this is government data or something similar.
This Perk indicates that the character has received accreditation as an 	expert and instructor in a specific martial arts style by a recognized body 	which regulates that style.
This optional Perk indicates the character is recognized as a "black 	belt," or expert fighter, by a governing body of his style and has the right to 	refer to himself as such.
Only characters in feudal-era Japanese campaigns can take this Fringe 	Benefit. It represents a samurai's right to kill anyone of a lower social 	class.
This is a necessary perk of Buddhist monk characters.

option.display: Low-level executive of a minor business
Mid-level executive of a minor business
High-level executive of a minor business
Low-level executive of a major business
Mid-level executive of a major business
High-level executive of a major business
Chairman of BoD of a minor business
Chairman of BoD of a major business
Gang/organized crime group member of prominence or importance
Mid- to high-level organized crime leader
Deputy director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Deputy director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Deputy director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Associate director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Associate director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Associate director/administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Director of a department in CIA directorate
Director of a department in CIA directorate
Administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Administrator of a department in CIA directorate
Associate Deputy Director of a CIA directorate
Deputy Director of a CIA directorate
Deputy Director of a Central Intelligence (DDCI)
National government departmental employee of minor power
Judge on a lower federal court
Member of U.S. House of Representatives of minor power
National government departmental employee of major power
Member of U.S. House of Representatives of major power
Member of U.S. Senate of minor power
Deputy Director/Administrator of major national government agency
Chief Justice, national States Supreme Court
Member of U.S. Senate of major power
Director of major national government agency
Director/leader of governmental department or branch
Deputy commander of police for a small city
Commander of police for a small city
Deputy commander of police for a large city
Commander of police for a large city
Special Agent in Charge of an FBI office
Assistant Director of an FBI division
Executive Assistant Director of an FBI division

fringeBenefit.definition: A Fringe Benefit is a Perk which the character acquires from his job or background - a "perk" in the classic sense.

money.definition: This Perk allows the character to begin with a better than average financial position.

option.definition: Income of $500,000 or less per year. The character has more than enough 	money to support himself.
Income of $5,000,000 or less per year. The character is a typical 	millionaire.
Unlimited income. The character is a typical 	multi-billionaire.

reputation.definition: This Perk represents a Reputation which is more likely to help a character than hinder him.

option.display: A small to medium sized group

vehicleBase.definition: A character with this Perk has a Vehicle or Base of some kind.

talent.definition: A character with this Talent can detect the distance between himself and any object within his Line Of Sight accurately without the aid of any external measuring devices.
A character with this Talent can gauge the passage of time accurately without using a watch, the sun, or other external means.
This Talent allows the character to use either hand to perform tasks with no penalty.
The character has an innate bond with animals, or a mystical ability to make animals like and respect him.
A character with this Talent has an innate sense of direction. He can always tell direction without reference to visual clues, and can also tell if he is above or below the local ground level.
The character's skill with weapons allows him to strike highly accurate and deadly blows.
A character with this Talent has unusually flexible joints. Double Jointed gives a bonus to Contortionist rolls (and sometimes Breakfall rolls as well).
A character with this Talent has a photographic memory. He can remember images and other sensations which he's studied (including written pages) with near photographic exactness.
A character with this Talent has the innate ability to perform mathematical operations mentally with startling speed. The time required for a calculation depends on its complexity.

A character with this Talent sleeps lightly, and therefore is rarely surprised while asleep. A character with Lightsleep makes his normal PER Roll to wake up, and may also conceal the fact he has awakened with a successful EGO Roll.

A character with Off-Hand Defense is skilled at using a weapon in his Off Hand to blockand parry attacks. When he has a weapon in his Off Hand he receives +1 DCV in HTH Combat.It's most appropriate for Martial Arts campaigns, but may be suitable for characters in someother genres and settings. When Blocking, a character with Off-Hand Defense may add his DCVbonus to his OCV to determine if the Block succeeds.
A character with this Talent can tell the exact pitch of a musical tone by listening. Perfect Pitch also adds a +1 to any music related Skill Roll.
The character's skill with weapons allows him to strike highly accurate and deadly blows.

combatLuck.definition: This Talent represents a character's ability to avoid damage in combat. Although referred to as Combat Luck, it can indicate a character's skill in dodging attacks.

combatSense.definition: This Talent gives the character an innate ability to fight effectively even while in darkness or blinded.

dangerSense.definition: A character with this Talent has a sixth sense about danger. A successful Danger Sense roll prevents him from being surprised. If he reacts, he's allowed his full DCV against an attack; he may, if he wishes, Abort to a defensive Action such as Dodge.

adder.definition: Danger Sense works automatically and does not require a Half 	Phase.

option.definition: The character's Danger Sense also functions out of 		combat.
The character will be forewarned of any danger to his person, 		regardless of the source or whether he could detect the danger with his 		other senses.
The character can detect danger to anyone or anything in his 		immediate vicinity (say, the room he is standing in).
The character can detect danger to anyone in his general area 		(city).
The character can detect any danger to anyone over any 		area.

adder.definition: This form of Danger Sense represents an almost preternatural intuitive 	ability which tell the character that, "Something's not right here...." He will 	still get his full DCV against dangers, but cannot make attacks at full OCV 	when he rolls less than or equal to half his Danger Sense roll.

environmentalMovement.definition: A character with this Talent can move easily and without restrictions in an environment which hampers most characters.

lightningReflexesAll.definition: A character with this Talent has higher DEX only for the purpose of acting earlier in a Phase.

resistance.definition: Resistance represents a character's ability to resist interrogation and questioning through self-hypnosis, meditation, or pure stubbornness. It also helps a character fool lie detectors.

simulateDeath.definition: This Talent allows a character to slow his metabolism down to the point where he appears completely dead (although a thorough medical investigation would reveal signs of life).

speedReading.definition: This Talent allows a character to read books and documents up to ten times faster than normal. When combined with Eidetic Memory, Speed Reading allows a character to memorize documents as fast as he can turn the pages.

strikingAppearance.definition: Striking Appearance provides a bonus to Interaction Skill rolls and Presence Attacks, but exactlywhich ones depend on how it's defined. If a character's defined as "beautiful" or "handsome,"then the bonus applies to many uses of Skills like Charm, Conversation, and Persuasion, and toPresence Attacks that might work better coming from an attractive person (such as, "Won't youplease help me?"). If a character's defined as "ugly," the bonus applies to many uses ofInterrogation and to Presence Attacks based on fear or disgust.

universalTranslator.definition: A character with this Talent can understand any form of communication - from verbal speech, to obscure body language, to written text.

modifier.definition: Absorption with this 	Advantage can be switched from phase to phase to work against either physical 	or energy attacks.
Absorption with this 	Limitation only works against certain types of physical or energy phenomena.
At the GM's option, Absorption does function as a defense if the character buys the	Advantage Defensive Absorption.

absorption.definition: A character with Absorption may absorb the BODY damage of an attack and add that energy, as Character Points, to a specific Power or Characteristic. Some examples of Absorption include a character whose STR increases when he's struck with physical blows or an alien who feeds off energy. When a character purchases Absorption, he specifies whether it works versus energy or physical attacks and where the absorbed Character Points go.

aid.definition: A character with Aid may increase one of his or someone else's Characteristics or Powers. Some examples of Aid include a character who acts as a "living battery" to boost other's STR and END, or an enchanted item which increases a wizard's magical powers. A character must define what Characteristic or Power his Aid can increase when he buys it.

modifier.definition: This form of Aid does not work on the character who has the Power. He	can only use his Aid to improve other characters' Characteristics or Powers.
This form of Aid only works on the character who has the Power. He cannot	use his Aid to improve other characters' Characteristics or Powers.

This means the character has to continue to pay END every Phase to keep the Boosted	Characteristic or Power at its Boosted level (doing this is an Action that takes no time). As long	as the character pays END, the Boost doesn't fade at the usual rate of 5 Character Points per	Turn. Once the character stops paying END, the Character Points gained from Boost fade	immediately.

forcewall.definition: A character with Barrier can create a defensive wall. Some examples of Barrier include protective screens of energy, force domes, or walls of enchanted fire.

adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character to make his Barrier Opaque to a Sense or Sense Group.

This Adder allows a character to create a Barrier that doesn't have to be anchored to anything -- for example,he could create one in mid-air.   However, the Barrier is still stationary, and it cannot be droppedon a character as an attack.

modifier.definition: This means the character has to continue to pay END every Phase to keep the Barrier active.
With the GM's permission, characters can apply this Advantage for Resistant Protection to a Barrier.
This Advantage 	represents a Force Wall which reflects back any attacks made by a trapped 	character in an attempt to break free from being surrounded by a Barrier.
Ordinarily, a character cannot change the shape of a Barrier once he's created it.  This Advantageallows him to alter the shape of a Barrier as a Half Phase Action.

A Barrier with this Advantage blocks Indirect attacks made by characters on oneside of the Barrier against characters on the other side (regardless of how the Indirect's definedas woorking).   A character can buy this Advantage for a Barrier multiple times to counteract multiplepurchases of Indirect, if desired.
Barriers are usually immobile:  once setup they stay in place.  This Advantage allows the Barrierto be moved once created.
A character can make 	his Barrier transparent in one direction to a category of attack by buying the entire Barrier with this 	Advantage.

option.display: single attack or specific group of attacks

modifier.definition: A Barrier with this Limitation cannot be used to englobe targets.
When a Barrier with 	this Limitation takes damage, its creator takes the same amount, with the Barrier's 	defenses applying as if they were Resistant Protection.
A Barrier with this 	Limitation provides only Normal defenses, not Resistant defenses.
This Limitation 	represents that the Character must always create his Barrier in the same 	shape. He must define the shape when buying the Power.
A Barrier bought 	with this Limitation only protects the character who creates it.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

energyblast.definition: A character with Blast can attack at Range, doing Normal Damage. Examples of Blasts include a superhero's force blast, many types of blunt throwing weapons, a wizard's bolt of mystical energy, rubber bullets, or a Galactic Trooper's blaster rifle.

modifier.definition: A character may define 	his Blast as a STUN Only attack against PD or ED.

option.display: Takes No STUN (loses abilities when takes BODY)

changeenvironment.definition: A character with Change Environment can causes changes to his environment. The character could, for example, alter the temperature, create an intense magnetic field, or cause all plants in the area to bloom.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

adder.display: -[LVL] to Characteristic Roll or Skill Roll
-[LVL] Characteristic Roll and all Skill Rolls based on Characteristic

adder.definition: With the Adder the effect of a Change Environment lasts for a period of 	time after the character stops paying END to maintain the Change 	Environment.

modifier.definition: A Change Environment 	power with this Advantage can create more than one type of effect.
This Limitation means that the Change Environment doesn't cover an area, only the character.

clairsentience.definition: A character with Clairsentience can use one or more of his senses (usually Normal Sight) at a distance, and sometimes to perceive the future or past. Examples of Clairsentience include mystic scrying spells, borescopes used to see through walls and around corners, and closed-circuit television systems.

adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character to perceive events which have already happened in the 	past.
This Adder allows a 	character to perceive "visions" of the future.
This Adder allows 	Clairsentience to view into one additional dimensions.
This Adder allows 	Clairsentience to view into group of dimensions.

adder.display: Mobile Perception Point (can move up to [LVL]m per Phase)
adder.definition: This Adder allows the character 	to move the perception point up to 12m per Phase while the Clairsentience Power 	remains active.
This Adder allows the character 	to have the ability to perceive multiple perception points at once.

modifier.definition: This Limitation means 	that Clairsentience can only be used for Precognition or Postcognition, thus 	not being able to use the Power as normal Clairsentience.
Precognition or 	Retrocognition with this Limitation only provides visions to the character 	through dreams.
Precognition or 	Retrocognition with this Limitation is harder to use over greater spans of 	time.
Clairsentience with this 	Limitation requires and Attack Roll against DCV 3 every time the character 	tries to place his perception point.
This Limitation 	signifies that the character cannot use his normal Senses while using his 	Clairsentience.

modifier.display: Only Through The Senses Of Others
modifier.definition: This form of 	Clairsentience uses the Senses of others to perceive through. In effect, the 	character must have another creature to use as his perception 	point.
Clairsentience with this 	Limitation has a fixed perception point defined when the power is purchased. 	The perception point cannot be changed thereafter.
Clairsentience with this 	Limitation does not work with a Sense Group at its base level, but only a 	single Sense.
Precognition or 	Retrocognition with this Limitation simulates an ability to foretell the future 	or uncover the past which is, at best, unreliable.

clinging.definition: A character with Clinging may cling to walls and sheer surfaces and move on them as if they were level. Some examples of Clinging include high-tech clinging-grips used by climbers or insect-based wall-crawling powers.

modifier.definition: Characters cannot use 	Clinging to resist the effects of Knockback.

compoundpower.definition: Compound Powers are meant to help in the creation of complex Power designs that are either partially Advantaged or partially Limited. You build each "section" of the Power individually, assigning any Modifiers that you choose. The overall cost for the Compound Power is calculated from all of its "sections"

damagenegation.definition: A character with Damage Negation can reduce the damage of attacks made against him.

modifier.definition: Damage Negation with 	this Limitation effects STUN or BODY damage only.
Damage Negation with 	this Limitation only functions against Normal Damage attacks and AVADs.

damagereduction.definition: A character with Damage Reduction is tougher than normal characters; only part of any damage which gets through his defenses is applied to his STUN or BODY. Characters purchase Damage Reduction separately for each type of attack (Physical, Energy or Mental), list it as a percentage (it removes 25%, 50%, or 75% of the damage taken), and must define it as Normal or Resistant.

modifier.definition: Damage Reduction with 	this Limitation effects STUN or BODY damage only.
Damage Reduction with 	this Limitation only works against a specific special effect, or does not 	protect against attacks of a specific special effect.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

darkness.definition: A character with Darkness can create a field which is impervious to one Sense Group (usually the Sight Group). Some examples of Darkness include smoke grenades, mystic spells of silence, and blinding fields of impenetrable darkness.

modifier.definition: Darkness fields are usually immobile:  once setup they stay in place.  This Advantage allows the Darknessto be moved once created.

missiledeflection.definition: A character with Missile Deflection and Reflection can block or avoid incoming Ranged attacks. Some examples of Missile Deflection include blocking Ranged attacks with a shield, a special technique for dodging out of the way of an attack, or a character who is so tough that Ranged attacks simple "bounce off" him when he is prepared for them.

densityincrease.definition: A character with Density Increase can increase his density, thereby making himself stronger and physically tougher. Some examples of Density Increase include characters whose bodies are made of rock or metal, or a superhero with gravitic powers who can make himself denser.

modifier.definition: DI with this Limitation 	does not provide any extra STR to the character.

option.display: does not provide PD or ED

modifier.definition: DI with this Limitation 	does not provide any extra PD or ED to the character.

desolidification.definition: A character with Desolidification can become intangible, allowing him to walk through walls and ignore attacks. Some examples of Desolidification include the intangible body of a ghost, a superhero who can pass through solid objects by synchronizing the "phase vibrations" of his molecules, and a vampire's ability to transform into a cloud of mist.

modifier.definition: Ordinarily, a character is either entirely Desolidified, or	entirely solid - he can't be partly intangible and partly tangible. A character with this	Advantage, which requires the GM's permission, can make himself only partly Desolidified, or	while Desolidified can selectively solidify part of his body (typically his hands). Selectively solid	parts of the body can affect the physical world normally, and in turn be affected by it normally	(which may involve use of the Hit Location table to target specific areas of the body).

This Limitation 	represents a form of Desolidification which does not provide true 	intangibility. The character can squeeze through very tiny openings, but cannot 	actually pass through solid objects.
Desolidification with 	this Limitation offers no protection against damage.

modifier.display: Only To Protect Against [Limited Type Of Attack]
modifier.definition: The Character can 	purchase limited form of Desolidification to offer protection from a particular 	type of attack.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

modifier.display: Expanded Effect (x[LVL] Characteristics or Powers simultaneously)
modifier.definition: This Advantage allows an Adjustment Power to have its full effect	against two or more game elements simultaneously.
This Advantage allows a character to vary which game element his Adjustment Power affectswithin a defined special effect category (or other large group)

This means the character has to continue to pay END every Phase to keep the Suppressed	Characteristic or Power at its Suppressed level (doing this is an Action that takes no time). As long	as the character pays END, the Suppress doesn't fade at the usual rate of 5 Character Points per	Turn. Once the character stops paying END, the Character Points lost from Suppress return	immediately.

dispel.definition: A character with Dispel can turn off another character's powers. Some examples of Dispel include spells designed to disrupt or "break" other spells, light-based powers which can Dispel Darkness fields, or the ability to destroy or ruin gadgets.

doesnotbleed.definition: An Automaton with this Power doesn't "bleed" or lose additional BODY when under 0 BODY.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

drain.definition: A character with Drain can temporarily lower the value of one of his opponent's Characteristics or Powers. The character must specify which specific Power or Characteristic he can Drain when he purchases Drain.

modifier.definition: This Limitation 	represents a form of Drain against which PD provides protection.
This Limitation 	represents a form of Drain against which ED provides protection.
This means the character has to continue to pay END every Phase to keep the Suppress active.

duplication.definition: A character with this Special Power can create duplicates of himself, which may have the same or different abilities than he does. Duplicates are built on the same Base Points as the base character, and should have the same amount of points' worth of Complications as well.

adder.display: Easy Recombination (Half Phase Action at 1/2 DCV)
adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character to recombine any or all of his Duplicates as a Half Phase 	action.

adder.display: Easy Recombination (Zero-Phase Action at Full DCV)
adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character to recombine any or all of his Duplicates as a Zero Phase 	action.

modifier.display: Rapid Duplication (can create [LVL] Duplicates per Half Phase)
modifier.definition: For every +1/4 Advantage, a charactercan create x2 the number of Duplicates in a Half Phase.
This Advantage allows 	for created Duplicates to have different abilities, personalities, equipment, 	memories, or Disadvantages.

option.display: All of Duplicate's points spent differently

modifier.definition: This Advantage allows a 	character to recombine any or all of his Duplicates at Range, without 	touching.
This Limitation 	represents a form of Duplication which does not allow the Duplicate to 	recombine.
This Limitation 	represents a shared bond of some sort between the Duplicates. As a result of 	the bond, all of them suffer any damage which any one of them 	takes.

option.display: All Duplicates Take Damage When Struck
Only When Base Character Is Struck

modifier.definition: Generally, a character must define which of his powers draw END from		an Endurance Reserve, and is not entitled to a Limitation for this. But in some cases, an		Endurance Reserve can supply END to only some types of powers, abilities, or devices.

endurancereserve.definition: A character with END Reserve has an independent source of Endurance which provides END to run powers. END Reserves can simulate the generator and batteries of a suit of powered armor, the "mana" in a magical wand, the fuel in a jetpack, or any other ability where the energy powering the effect does not come from the character's own END. To set up an END Reserve, a character purchases the END and the REC for the Reserve.

modifier.definition: An END Reserve with 		this Limitation can only recover END in certain circumstances, such as only 		when plugged into an electrical outlet.

This Limitation 		represents and END Reserve which can only recover if the character can 		recover. If the character is knocked out, cannot breathe, or otherwise not 		take a Recovery himself, the END Reserve cannot recover either.
This Limitation 		represents and END Reserve which recovers END more slowly than the usual 		rate.

detect.definition: Detect allows the character to perceive whatever he defines as its subject - Detect Gold, Detect Minds, Detect Aliens, whatever he can think of and the GM allows. A base Detect requires a Half Phase to use and has no Range.

adder.display: Each Extra Thing or Class of Things

activesonar.definition: A character with Active Sonar can sense nearby objects by emitting high-frequency sound which bounces off those objects and returns to him.

hrrp.definition: The character can perceive and transmit along the entire broadcast spectrum, from radio to television to cellular phone transmissions; HRRH also allows him to sense radar emissions.

infraredperception.definition: The character can perceive heat patterns and traces, but can only perceive the outline of people and objects. Cold objects are perceived as "dark" while hot objects may be blindingly "bright."

mentalawareness.definition: The character can perceive the use of Mental Powers within his Line of Sight. He can perceive the user and target of a Mental Power, but not the type of Mental Power.

nightvision.definition: The character can see in total darkness (not including the power Darkness) as though it were normal daylight.

radar.definition: A character with Radar can sense nearby objects by emitting radio waves which bounce off those objects and return to him. Radar can be perceived by HRRH.

radioperception.definition: The character can perceive local AM, FM, and police-band radio signals.

radioperceivetransmit.definition: The character can perceive and transmit local AM, FM, and police-band radio signals.

spatialawareness.definition: The character may sense his surrounds without having any contact with them. It can simulate a wide variety of senses from "mystical awareness" to passive sonar to molecular analysis.

ultrasonicperception.definition: The character can perceive very high and low frequency sounds, such as dog whistles or Active Sonar.

ultravioletperception.definition: The character can perceive ultraviolet light. He perceive as well at night as he can during the day, providing there is a source of UV light such as the moon or stars.

adjacentfixed.definition: This Sense Modifier allows a character to perceive not from where he's standing, but apoint up to 2m away from himself.

adjacent.definition: This Sense Modifier allows a character to perceive not from where he's standing, but apoint up to 2m away from himself.

concealed.definition: This Sense Modifier makes it harder for other characters to detect the pulses or emissions of an Active Sense, or of a Sense with Transmit.

makeasense.definition: A Detect (or other Enhanced Sense, at the GM's option) may be turned into a Sense. Characters can use a Sense without a Half Phase Action; it can be set off by contact at any time.

dimensionalsingle.display: Perceive into a single other dimension
dimensionalsingle.definition:
(A Sense with this Sense Modifier
			can perceive into another dimension in addition to the one the character is currently occupying.

dimensionalgroup.display: Perceive into a related group of dimensions
dimensionalgroup.definition:
A Sense with this Sense Modifier
			can perceive into another dimension in addition to the one the character is currently occupying.

dimensionalall.definition:
A Sense with this Sense Modifier
			can perceive into another dimension in addition to the one the character is currently occupying.

discriminatory.definition: A Sense with Discriminatory can identify, distinguish, and analyze an object if the character makes a PER Roll. For example, using Detect Metals, Discriminatory would tell a character that a nearby mass of metal is a iron/nickel composite about 65% Nickel and weighing 200kg.

analyzesense.definition: A Sense with Analyze can determine an even greater range of information, with greater precision, than can a Sense with Discriminatory

enhancedperception.definition: The character has better perception than normal.

increasedarc240.definition: This Sense Modifier allows Detects to function in a 240-degree arc.

increasedarc360.definition: This Sense Modifier allows Detects to function in a 360-degree arc. A sense with 360-Degree Perception operates all around the character, rather than being directional like ordinary Senses.

microscopic.definition: A Sense with this Sense Modifier can detect objects in quantities so small they cannot be perceived by standard Senses.

partiallypenetrative.definition: A Partially Penetrative Sense canperceive through a limited number or types of blocking objects, substances, or phenomena, but isblocked by all others.

penetrative.definition: A Fully PenetrativeSense can perceive through all types of blocking objects, substances, or phenomena, but thecharacter must define one or more reasonably common substance(s), or a group of uncommonsubstance(s), he cannot perceive through.

range.definition: A nonranged Sense (such as Touch or Detect) with this Sense Modifier can perceive at Range in a 120-degree arc with the usual Range Modifiers (just like, for example, Normal Sight).

rapid.definition: A character with Rapid Sense can use that Sense to "read" or otherwise take in or absorb data or sensations much faster than normal.

targetingsense.definition: A Nontargeting Sense (such as Normal Hearing) with this Sense Modifier can be used as a Targeting Sense to locate targets in combat.

telescopic.definition: A Sense with this Sense Modifier works more accurately over long distances than an ordinary Sense.

trackingsense.definition: A Sense with this Sense Modifier, most often bought with Smell/Taste Group, can be used to identify and track a person or object if the character makes a PER Roll.

transmit.definition: This Sense Modifier allows a character to transmit information similar to that which he can perceive.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.
This Adder represents 	an Entangle which blocks a certain Sense.
This Adder represents 	an Entangle which blocks a certain Sense Group.
This Adder represents 	an Entangle which has more BODY than ordinary.
This Adder represents 	an Entangle which has more PD than ordinary.
This Adder represents 	an Entangle which has more ED than ordinary.

entangle.definition: A character with Entangle can restrain, immobilize, or paralyze another character. He can also create barriers. Some examples of Entangle include ice bonds, handcuffs, glue bombs, paralytic touch, gravity manipulation, and transforming the ground to mud so the target sinks into it and cannot move.

modifier.definition: This Advantage 	represents an Entangle which reflects back any attacks made by the entangled 	character in an effort to break free.
An Entangle with this 	Advantage is transparent to attacks, allowing attackers to damage the entangled 	character without damaging the Entangle itself.

option.display: All Attacks, STR only to break out

modifier.display: Entangle And Character Both Take Damage
modifier.definition: This Advantage 	represents an Entangle which does not protect the entangled character. Both the 	Entangle and the entangled character take damage from an attack.
An Entangle with this 	Limitation has no DEF, only BODY.

modifier.display: Does Not Prevent The Use Of Accessible Foci
modifier.definition: An Entangle with this 	Limitation does not prevent the character from using most Accessible 	Foci.
An Entangle with this 	Limitation only entangles the target's hands or feet; his other limbs remain 	free.
An Entangle with this 	Limitation can be Dispelled after it has been set.
An Entangle with this 	Limitation is brittle; it has normal DEF, but only 1 BODY.
The DEF of an Entangle 	with this Limitation is not Resistant, so Killing Attacks damage it 	easily.
This Limitation 	represents an Entangle which can be completely removed by some substance or 	effect which would not cause damage to a normal Entangle.
An Entangle with this 	Limitation is unusually vulnerable to particular types of attacks; taking 	double damage from them.

option.display: Single Dimension, Any Location corresponding to current physical location
Related Group of Dimensions, Single Location
Related Group of Dimensions, Any Location
Related Group of Dimensions, Any Location corresponding to current physical location
Any Dimension, Any Location corresponding to current physical location
Single Point in Time, Physical Location Same As Starting Location
Related Group of Points in Time, Physical Location Same As Starting Location
Any Point in Time, Physical Location Same As Starting Location
Single Point in Time, Single Physical Location Other Than Starting Location
Related Group of Points in Time, Single Physical Location Other Than Starting Location
Any Point in Time within 50 Billion Years, future or past, Single Physical Location Other Than Starting Location
Single Point in Time, Limited Group Of Physical Locations
Related Group of Points in Time, Limited Group Of Physical Locations
Any Point in Time within 50 Billion Years, future or past, Limited Group Of Physical Locations
Single Point in Time, Any Physical Location
Related Group of Points in Time, Any Physical Location
Any Point in Time within 50 Billion Years, future or past, Any Physical Location

extradimensionalmovement.definition: A character with this Movement Power can travel from one dimension to another. Some examples of Extra-Dimensional Movement include wizards who can open gates to other planes, starships capable of breeching dimensional barriers, and time travel machines.

adder.definition: This Adder allows the 	character to transport additional weight.

extralimbs.definition: A character with Extra Limbs has one or more usable extra limbs. Some examples of Extra Limbs include a prehensile tail, extra arms, or a group of tentacles. Extra Limbs have no direct effect on combat, but characters can use them to perform maneuvers not possible to bipedal humans.

modifier.definition: Extra Limbs with this 	Limitation are not as functional as human hands and lack the ability to perform 	fine manipulation tasks.

ftl.definition: A character with FTL Travel can travel as fast as, or faster than, light when in space. Some examples of FTL Travel include a starship's hyperdrive or a character who can transform himself into pure light.

adder.definition: A character using FTL Travel has to accelerate to, or	decelerate from, full velocity. If a character buys this +10 Character Point Adder for FTL Travel,	he can accelerate to or decelerate from his full maximum velocity with FTL Travel in one Full	Phase and 2m of space.
An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

flash.definition: A character with Flash can temporarily disable or "blind" an opponent's Senses. Some examples of Flash include blinding bursts of light, deafening shrieks of sound, pepper spray, or poking someone in the eyes.

modifier.display: Does Not Work Against Desolidified Characters
modifier.definition: This Limitation 	represents a Flash which cannot affect a Desolidified character.

flashdefense.definition: A character with Flash Defense suffers less effect from Flashes. Some examples of Flash Defense include sunglasses, earplugs, or nictitating membranes which protect the eyes from bright light.

flight.definition: A character with Flight can fly through the air, a vacuum, space, or most other three-dimensional environments (though not through water or other liquids). Some examples of Flight include wings, jetpacks, boot rockets or planes.

modifier.definition: Flight purchased with this 	Limitation can only be used for Gliding.

option.display: must move at least 2m per Phase
must make at least a Half Move per Phase

modifier.display: Only In Contact With A Surface
modifier.definition: This Limitation 	represents a form of Flight which only works when the character touches a 	surface. Some examples include flying on water or up the side of a 	building.

growth.definition: A character with this Size Power can increase his size. This increases his STR, BODY, STUN, mass, and height, and reduces his DCV and the Knockback he takes.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

modifier.definition: This is a mandatory 	Limitation for the Hand-To-Hand Attack Power

handtohandattack.definition: A character with Hand-To-Hand Attack (HA) does more than his normal amount of damage in HTH Combat. Each die of HA adds to the character's regular damage from STR. Examples of HA include clubs, especially powerful punches, or energized gauntlets which improve a character's punch.

adder.definition: This Adder allows 	Healing to regrow lost limbs.
This Adder allows 	Healing to restore life to the dead.

healing.definition: A character with Healing can restore lost or reduced Characteristics and Powers to their starting values, and once restored the Healed Characteristic or Power does not fade. Some examples of Healing include a wizard's spell which heals damage from sword-blows, a werewolf's ability to regenerate damage, or the ability to purge the effects of disease from others.

modifier.display: Does Not Work On Some Damage
modifier.definition: Healing with this 	Limitation does not work against one or more types of damage.
This Advantage allows a character to apply Healing more than once a day.
Healing with this 	Limitation can only be used to resurrect the dead; it cannot Heal characters 	who are still living.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

images.definition: A character with Images can create images which other characters can perceive with their appropriate Sense (usually Sight Sense Group). Some examples of Images include spells of illusion, holograms, and sound synthesizers.

modifier.definition: This Limitation	simulates a form of Images to Sight Group which can only create 	light.
This Limitation	represents a form of Images which the character can only use to create a single 	Image.

option.display: simple changes take a Half Phase
simple changes take a Full Phase

invisibility.definition: A character with Invisibility can become invisible to one Sense Group (usually the Sight Sense Group). Some examples of Invisibility include a "stealth plane" which cannot be detected by radar, the ability to move absolutely quietly or to hide effortlessly in shadows, or a superhero's ability to fade from sight. Invisibility has a Fringe which others may perceive with a normal PER Roll at a range of 1" or less.

adder.definition: This Adder represents 	Invisibility which has no Fringe effect.

modifier.definition: Invisibility with this 	Limitation has a Fringe that is easier to perceive than usual. The Fringe may 	be perceived from up to 8" away with a normal PER Roll.
This Limitation 	represents a form of Invisibility which only works if the character remains 	motionless.
This Limitation 	represents Invisibility which only works if the character remains peaceful and 	does not attack or threaten anyone.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

hka.definition: A character with Hand-To-Hand Killing Attack (HKA) can make an attack in HTH Combat which causes Killing Damage. Some examples of HKA include claws, fangs, bladed weapons such as knives, and laser swords.

modifier.definition: This Power Advantage 	increases the STUN Multiplier of a Killing Attack.
A Killing Attack with 	this Limitation tends to do less STUN than a regular Killing 	Attack.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

rka.definition: A character with Ranged Killing Attack (RKA) can make an attack in Ranged Combat which causes Killing Damage. Some examples of RKA include bullets, arrows, lasers, flamethrowers, and throwing knives.

modifier.definition: This Power Advantage 	increases the STUN Multiplier of a Killing Attack.
A Killing Attack with 	this Limitation tends to do less STUN than a regular Killing 	Attack.

kbresistance.definition: A character with Knockback Resistance reduces the Knockback he takes from attacks. Knockback Resistance reduces both the inches traveled and the amount of damage done by Knockback.

lifesupport.definition: A character with Life Support can operate in unfriendly or deadly environments without harm, and/or needs reduced resources to maintain his health and life. Examples of Life Support include gas masks, SCUBA gear, elixirs of eternal youth, and taking tiny doses of a poison to build up an immunity to its effects.

adder.definition: A character may hold 	his breath longer than normal.
The character may 	breathe in one type of unusual environment (under water, in methane, and so 	on).
The character's 	breathing is self-contained (he does not need to breathe at all).
Diminished Eating 	increases the time periods during which the character can go without food and 	drink (and thus diminish his need to excrete as well).

option.display: Character only has to eat once per week
Character only has to eat once per year

adder.definition: Diminished Sleep 	decreases the amount of sleep a character needs.

option.display: Character only has to sleep 8 hours per week
Character only has to sleep 8 hours per year

adder.definition: The character ages more 	slowly than normal people.
The character is immune 	to the effects of a particular drug, poison, disease, or similar 	substance.

luck.definition: This Power represents a quality of fate which helps events turn in a character's favor.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.
This Limitation 	represents a form of Ego Attack against which PD provides 	protection.
This Limitation 	represents a form of Ego Attack against which ED provides 	protection.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

egoattack.definition: A character with Mental Blastcan directly attack another character's mind to cause STUN damage. Some examples of Mental Blast include pain infliction, induce sleeping or euphoria, or harmful "mental feedback."

mentaldefense.definition: A character with Mental Defense is resistant to Mental Attacks - he can withstand some of the effects of Mental Powers. Some examples of Mental Defense include psionic shields or extremely strong willpower.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.
Mental Illusions with this Limitation cannot cause STUN or BODY	damage, or have similar effects.
The accuracy of this form of Mental Illusion depends on the character's knowledge	(much like and Image).
This simulates a form 	of Mental Illusion which a character can only use to change his outward 	appearance.
This Limitation 	represents a Mental Illusion power which for some reason cannot affect certain 	senses.

mentalillusions.definition: A character with this Mental Power can project illusions directly into an opponent's mind. Some examples of Mental Illusion include psionic illusion powers and hallucination-inducing drugs.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

modifier.definition: An Entangle with this 	Limitation can be Dispelled after it has been set.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.
This Advantage 	represents Mind Control which doesn't require verbal communication.

Mind Control with this Limitation is always subject to literalinterpretation of the wording of the order, meaning that victims can make everyeffort to avoid obeying, or obey in objectionable ways, if the characterdoesn't word his orders carefully and precisely.
This Limitation 	represents Mind Control which only allows a single command. An example would 	be: Only To Control/Inflict Emotions (Empathy) or Single Command "Go 	Home".

mindcontrol.definition: A character with this Mental Power can take control of another character's mind, and thus of his actions. Examples of Mind Control include psionic domination powers, some forms of brainwashing, and hypnosis.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.

modifier.display: Only With Others Who Have Mind Link
modifier.definition: A character can only 	use Mind Link with this Limitation to communicate with other people who have 	also purchased the same form of Mind Link.

mindlink.definition: A character with Mind Link, a variation of Telepathy, can set up a specific link with a receptive (willing) mind, thereby allowing instant mental communication.

adder.display: Unlimited range in this dimension and can reach into other dimensions

adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character establish a Mind Link with certain other characters, regardless of 	whether LOS exists between them.
This Adder represents a 	Mind Link between two characters that is permanent, requires no LOS, and can be 	used at any time.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.
Mind Scan with this 	Advantage only works one way and prevents Mind Scanned targets from following 	the Mind Scan back and using a Mental Power on the scanner.
Mind Scan with this 	Advantage may work at a very low level even if the Effect Roll fails.

option.display: neither the character nor his target can use the link to attack each other mentally, but they can communicate
neither the character nor his target can use the link to attack each other mentally or communicate
the character cannot use the link to attack mentally or communicate, but target can mentally attack or communicate through the link

modifier.definition: Mind Scan with this 	Limitation is easier to avoid than normal.

mindscan.definition: A character with this Mental Power can mentally search an area to find another mind.

multiform.definition: A character with this Standard Power can change his original form into one or more other forms, each with its own abilities, personality, and Characteristics. Examples include a werewolf's ability to switch between human and lupine forms, a character whose suit of armor can "reconfigure" itself into many different types of armor, and a wizard's ability to assume the form of an animal.

adder.definition: A character with this 	Adder can shift forms as a Zero Phase action.

modifier.definition: This Limitations 	represents a type of Multiform in which the character has a difficult time 	retaining his personality and changing back to his true form.
This Limitation 	represents a character who will revert to his true form if he is Stunned or 	Knocked Out while in his Multiform.

modifier.display: Only When All Component Characters Are Present

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.

option.display: make the Target Effect of the Power Invisible to the victim

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.

powerdefense.definition: A character with Power Defense is especially resistant to Drains, Transfers, Transforms, and related attacks.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

reflection.definition: A character with this Attack Power can Reflect a Ranged attack that he's Blocked athis attacker, or another target.

modifier.definition: If a character takes this Limitation for Reflection, then he takesthe full damage (and other effects, including Knockback) from any attack he Reflects.
This Limitation represents a 	Reflection Power which only reflects a limited type of damage.

adder.definition: With this Adder, characters may use Regeneration to return to life when killed.

modifier.definition: Resurrection Regeneration with this Limitation can only resurrect the character;	it cannot help the character Recover BODY if he's alive.

modifier.display: Does Not Work On Some Damage
modifier.definition: Healing with this 	Limitation does not work against one or more types of damage.

regeneration.definition: This Special Power allows a character to regain BODY lost to injuriesand other effects at a much faster rate than normal.

forcefield.definition: Resistatnt Protection provides a character with points of Resistant Defense.

adder.definition: This Adder allows a 	character's Resistant Protection to protect items the character is carrying in his 	hands, including other people.
This Adder means that the Resistant Protection Power prevents the character	from establishing skin-to-skin contact with other characters when it's active.

modifier.definition: Allocatable Resistant Protection can have its points of defense re-allocated in 	any way, without changing its maximum or adding new categories of defense.

adder.definition: With this Adder, a character with Shape Shift 	can alter his Striking Appearance within a range of standards that the GM defines for the 	campaign

modifier.display: Costs END Only To Change Shape

modifier.definition: Be default Shape Shift encompasses a 	character's gear. If a character doesn't want that, he can take this 	Limitation.

shapeshift.definition: A character with Shape Shift can change his form as perceived by one or more Sense Groups without altering his Powers or other abilities.

shrinking.definition: A character with Shrinking can decrease in size, making it more difficult for other characters to see or attack him.

stretching.definition: A character with Stretching can stretch his body, make HTH attacks at Range, and reach for things which are a long distance away from him.

summon.definition: A character with Summon can summon a creature from another location or plane of existence, or create certain types of creatures.

swinging.definition: A character with Swinging can swing great distances from a line. The character can also move upwards by climbing or pulling himself up a swingline.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

modifier.display: Only Works On Limited Types Of Objects

telekinesis.definition: A character with Telekineses (TK) can manipulate objects at a distance.

modifier.definition: Telepathy with this 	Limitation can be Dispelled.

option.display: Inobvious Power, Invisible to Mental Group

modifier.definition: Most Powers and/or 	their sources can be perceived by two Sense Groups. The special effects of a 	Power with Invisible Power Effects are not perceivable when it is in use.

telepathy.definition: A character with Telepathy can read or send thoughts.

teleportation.definition: A character with this Movement Power can move from one point to another without physically travelling through the space in between the two points (typically the character "disappears" at the first point and "reappears" at his desired destination).

fixedlocation.definition: Any character with Teleport can memorize a Fixed Location. He can teleport to any of his Fixed Locations even if he cannot perceive them with a Targeting Sense, provided they are within his Range.

floatinglocation.definition: A Floating Fixed Location is identical to a Fixed Location, but may be changed. To change a Floating Fixed Location, the character must study the new location for a full Turn.

adder.definition: An Attack Power with this Adder can vary the point of origin of the Power on his body.
This Adder for Attack Powers counteracts Damage Negation.

transform.definition: A character with Transform can change a target into something else or impose a lasting change on it.

tunneling.definition: A character with Tunneling can move through the ground or other substances by creating a tunnel roughly his own size.

modifier.definition: This advantage allows a character to purchase a Power or Characteristic which can affect the real world while the character is Desolidified.

modifier.display: Powers Can Be Changed As A Half-Phase Action
modifier.definition: Changing Powers with a Skill Roll only takes a Half Phase, instead of the usual Full Phase.

modifier.display: Powers Can Be Changed As A Zero-Phase Action
modifier.definition: Changing Powers with a Skill Roll takes no appreciable time; the character can change them whenever he can perform a Zero Phase Action
A VPP with this Advantage requires no Skill Roll to change; the character can change it automatically.

A character can use an Adjustment Power with this Advantage to apply Adders to a Power which that Power does not already have. The character chooses what Adders to apply when he uses the Adjustment Power; the Adder applied can vary from use to use. The alternate version of this Modifier, Can Remove Adders, is appropriate for Adjustment Powers such as Drain.

option.alias: points return at the rate of 5 per Minute
points return at the rate of 5 per 5 Minutes
points return at the rate of 5 per 20 Minutes
points return at the rate of 5 per Hour
points return at the rate of 5 per 6 Hours
points return at the rate of 5 per Day
points return at the rate of 5 per Week
points return at the rate of 5 per Month
points return at the rate of 5 per Season
points return at the rate of 5 per Year
points return at the rate of 5 per 5 Years
points return at the rate of 5 per 25 Years
points return at the rate of 5 per Century

modifier.definition: The Character Points gained or lost via an Adjustment Power normally return to their previous value at the rate of 5 Character points per Turn. This Modifier allows you to increase the time that the effects of the Power last.

This Advantage allows a character to vary which game element his Adjustment Power affects
			within a defined special effect category (or other large group)

modifier.display: Expanded Effect (x[LVL] Characteristics or Powers simultaneously)
