modifier.definition: This Advantage allows an Adjustment Power to have its full effectagainst two or more game elements simultaneously.
If a character buys an Adjustment Power to affect a specific Power, it takes this Limitation if it can only affect that Power when the Power has a particular special effect.

Some Adjustment Powers can raise Characteristics and Powers far above their starting levels. If such a Power can only restore lost Characteristics and Powers (but not raise them above starting values), it is bought with this Limitation.
If a character cannot use an Adjustment Power on a target a subsequenttime until the first use fades entirely, it takes this Limitation.
This Limitation represents a Ranged Attack Power which manifests itself as a thin/narrow beam or similar type of effect.
Characters cannot normally Missile Deflect some Attack Powers -- such as Mental Powers, Powers bought with the Area of Effect Advantage, and most Entangles -- unless they take this Limitation.

modifier.display: Cannot Be Used With [specific combat maneuver]
modifier.definition: This Limitation represents and Attack Power which a character cannot use with a specific combat maneuver.
This Limitation, which only characters in campaigns that use the HIt Location rules can take, signifies that the Attack Power cannot be targeted at specific areas of the body.
An Attack Power with this Limitation never does Knockback, regardless of how much BODY was rolled.

modifier.display: Must Be Used At Full Power

modifier.definition: This Power Advantage "hardens" a particular defense, enabling it to counteract the Power Advantage Armor Piecing.
A Defense Power with this Advantage is particularly resistant to Penetrating Attacks.
This Advantage converts points of Normal Defense into points of Resistant Defense.
A Defense Power with this Limitation is shot off little by little by attacks.
This Limitation represents a Defense Power which only protects against a limited type of damage.

A Power with this Limitation becomes a normal attack with a range of 5" x Active Points, is subject to the Range Modifier, and requires an Attack Roll to hit its target. The target's Energy Defense or Physical Defense, not Mental Defense, apply against the attack.

modifier.display: Cannot Be Used Through Mind Link
modifier.definition: This Limitation represents a Mental Power which a character cannot use through a Mind Link.
This Limitation represents a continuing-effect Power which not only costs END to activate, but also costs END to maintain.

adder.display: Constant Power requires eye contact throughout use

modifier.definition: A Mental Power with this Limitation requires the character to establish eye contact to make an ECV Attack Roll. Typically a character can only make eye contact with a target within 6m of him in decent light.
If a Mental Power only works against a subset of a class of minds (such as a Mental Power which works on Humans, but Only Works On Men), it takes this Limitation.
A continuing-effect Mental Power takes this Limitation if the character must achieve a certain level of effect for the Power to have any effect at all.
A Mental Power with this Limitation ha a normal range (10m x Active Points) but is not subject to the Range Modifier.
A Mental Power with this LImitation requires the character to establish skin-to-skin contact in order to make an ECV Attack Roll.

modifier.display: Stops Working If Mentalist Is Stunned
modifier.definition: Ordinarily a character simply "starts" the proper effect of a continuing-effect Mental Power by making an ECV Attack Roll, and then can leave the power to work on its own. Even if he is Knocked OUt or Stunned, the Power keeps working. If this Limitation is taken, Knocking Out or Stunning the character causes the Power to shut off instantly.

modifier.display: Stops Working If Mentalist Is Knocked Out
modifier.definition: Ordinarily a character simply "starts" the proper effect of a continuing-effect Mental Power by making an ECV Attack Roll, and then can leave the power to work on its own. Even if he is Knocked OUt or Stunned, the Power keeps working. If this Limitation is taken, Knocking Out or Stunning the character causes the Power to shut off instantly.

A Movement Power with this Advantage does not 
			suffer the 1/2 speed restriction when moving upward.
A Movement Power with this Advantage does not have a Turn Mode
A Movement Power with this Advantage can be used as other forms of movement (for example, Swimming or Gliding).

A character can attain full Noncombat Movement velocity in a number of Phases equal to the
			number of doublings of his Noncombat Movement rate.

A character may accelerate or decelerate at a rate equal to his full meters of
			Combat Movement per meter (instead of the standard 5m/meter).
A character may accelerate or decelerate to his full meters of Noncombat Movement per meter.

Some movement abilities don't provide a character with as good performance,
			or as precise control, as regular movement powers.
Movement Powers with this Limitation cannot attain Noncombat Movement velocity.
Movement Powers which naturally lack a Turn Mode (such as Running) have a Turn Mode if they take this Limitation.
A Sense-Affecting Power with this LImitation only affects one or two Senses in a Sense Group, rather than the entire Sense Group.

When subject to Sense-Affecting Powers, some Senses are affected not as their usual Sense Group, but as some other Group. In most cases, this sort of "switch" is a -0 Limitation; in some circumstances (such as a very common Sense, i.e. Sight, is substituted for a very uncommon Sense), it might constitute a -1/4 Limitation.

modifier.display: Sense Affected As More Than One Sense
modifier.definition: Some Senses will be affected by Sense-Affecting Powers as if they are more than one Sense. For example, the radar screen on a battleship requires both Radar (which is built into the device) and Normal Sight (used to read the screen). This amounts to a Limitation on the Power.
With this Advantage a character cannot use Teleportation to escape from an Entangle, wall or other barrier.
A Power with Affects Desolidified can affect a character who is Desolidified -- a rather rude surprise for most Desolidified characters. It can also affect normal objects and characters.

Under the standard HERO System rules, Mental Powers are targeted with OMCV andattack against DMCV, and other types of Powers are targeted with OCV against DCV. At theGM's option, characters can buy the Power Modifier Alternate Combat Value ("ACV") tochange the form of (Mental) Combat Value used to target or resist a specific type of attack.
A Power with Area of Effect affects all targets in an area. To use an Area of Effect Power, target the center of the area on a hex (DCV 3).

An Armor Piercing Power is more effective at cutting through, or otherwise penetrating, a target's defenses. An Armor Piercing attack acts against one half (1/2) of the defense it normally acts against. The only effect of multiple levels of Armor Piercing is to negated Hardened.

example: Life Support (Self-Contained Breathing); target holds his breath
modifier.definition: A Power with AVAD is affected by a defense other than the one that's standardfor it.

adder.definition: This is used for Powers 	which do not affect normal defenses or for Powers which do not have a normal 	"To Hit" roll. Autofire purchased against these types of Powers must be 	purchased at an additional +1 cost.

modifier.definition: A character can use a Power with Autofire to hit a target more than once in a single Phase.

This Advantage allows the character to add successive effect rolls to one another, so that he can use a small amount of dice in a Power again and again, slowly building up to the point where he achieves enough power to have a real effect on the target.

modifier.display: Lock out (cannot be applied multiple times)

modifier.definition: This Power Modifier allows a character to inflict an attack on a target, then have that targetcontinue to take damage from the attack over specific intervals for a defined period of time. Dependingon the number of times the target takes damage, the length of the period, and how defenses apply,Damage Over Time can be an Advantage or a Limitation.
This Advantage allows a character to go through any length preparations needed to turn on a Power, then keep that Power "ready" before using it.
A Power with this Advantage is exceptionally difficult to Dispel or Suppresss.
This Advantage allows Attack Powers which ordinarily do only STUN damage -- such as Ego Attacks or AVADs -- to do BODY damage as well.
This Advantage enabled an Attack Power which normally doesn't do Knockback to do Knockback.
A Power with this Advantage has a greater chance of doing Knockback, and when it does Knockback, usually does much more than a Power without it.
This Advantage allows a character to use an Attack Power on a continuing basis without having to make a new Attack Roll every Phase against the same target.
A Power with this Advantage remains "turned on" even though the character is unconscious.
A Power with this Advantage is more than just Persistent -- it is a natural, inherent part of the character's being. It cannot be Dispelled, Drained, or Suppressed.

Characters can apply this Advantage to any Power which affects an area -- Darkness, Change Environment, Powers bought with the Advantages Explosion or Area of Effect, and the like. A Power with this Advantage has a hole in the center where the Power has no effect.

This Advantage prevents the character from being affected by his own Power.
This Power Advantage increases a Power's maximum range.

A character using a Power with this Advantage ignores the Range Modifier when making Attack Rolls with the Power.
A character using a Power with this Advantage uses half the normal Range Modifier when making Attack Rolls with the Power.
Powers which ordinarily have No Range can be used at Range if the character purchases this Advantage for them.
This Advantage allows a character to reduced the END Cost of a Power.
A Constant Power with this Advantage only costs END to turn on; it costs no END to maintain.

A Power with this Limitation is easier to perceive than normal.
This Limitation signifies a power that, while not built as a Focus or the like, has some physical embodiment that other characters can attack.
This Limitation represents a Ranged Power which does not work at Range.
This Limitation represents a Ranged Power which has less than the normal range (typically at least less than half, to be determined by GM)

This Limitation represents a Power which gets weaker over a distance.

An Attack Power bought with this Limitation has less ability to penetrate defenses than a normal attack. Reduced Penetration splits the attack into two equal parts for the purpose of determining BODY damage and applying that damage to the target's defenses.

This Limitation, which must be taken for a minimum of two differentpowers or abilities, represents the fact that the "unified" powers are all aspectsor facets of one over-arching "meta-power."

A Power with this Limitation can have a variety of different Limitations on it. The Power always has a set total of Limitations values, but the character can alter the exact type of Limitations to fit the circumstance.

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage has at least two forms or identities and sometimes accidentally or involuntarily changes between them.

option.display: Incompetence: -1 to Skill Rolls and related rolls per time increment
Weakness: -3 To Characteristic Rolls and related rolls per time increment

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage is dependent on a certain substance or item. If he cannot get it, he suffers negative effects, possibly even injury or death.

option.display: Slightly Less Powerful than the PC

adder.display: Unaware of character's adventuring career/Secret ID

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage has a non-player character friend, companion, or associate who often gets into trouble, requiring the character to protect or save him.

option.display: Always Noticed and Causes Major Reaction
Detectable Only By Technology Or Major Effort

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage has some easily recognizable feature(s) which are difficult to conceal.

A character with this Disadvantage tends to become extremely angry and lose control of himself when confronted by certain situations or stimuli. When a character is Enraged, he mindlessly attacks the individual (or object) which Enrages him. He attacks with no regard for defending himself, may not apply any Combat Skill Levels to DCV, and ignores other targets or teammates in need of help. Examples include creating a Programmer who gets Enraged when people are rude or condescending to him.

adder.display: PC has a Public ID or is otherwise very easy to find

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage is pusued by some person or group. The Hunter may show up during adventures and attempt to do something to the character. This can range from monitoring his activities, to interrogating him, to arresting him, to trying to kill him. The character may (or may not) know he is being Hunted (Player's choice).
A character with this Disadvantage has a physical problem which hampers him, such as blindness or a weak leg, or being Ben Seeman.

A character with this Disadvantage has a mental quirk or impairment regarding a given thing or situation. The character defines how often the condition affects him and the degree of impairment he suffers.

adder.display: Known Only To A Small Group

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage is viewed in an unfavorable light; also, people may know something harmful or disadvantageous about him. Sometimes a Reputation can be useful, but usually it should cause problems for the character.

option.display: Seek to Outdo, Embarrass, or Humiliate Rival
Seek to Harm or Kill Rival

disad.definition: A character with this Disadvantage is engaged in a not-so-friendly rivalry, whether professional, romantic, or both, with another character. The character will always attempt to outdo his Rival, though the extent to which he will go to do this depends on the strength of the Rivalry.
This Disadvantage means the character's ability to interact with society and/or other people is somehow limited, restricted, or more difficult than usual, or dangerous to him.
A character with this Disadvantage takes damage from objects or effects which are harmless to most people.

Improbably and unlucky things happen to a character who has Unluck. The GM should require an Unluck Roll when the character is winning easily in a fight, depending on a sure thing, succeeding easily, taking a simple task for granted, and so forth.
A character with this Disadvantage takes extra damage from a particular attack form.
